name: Oxcarbazepine (Trileptal)
summary: Oxcarbazepine is an anticonvulsant used to treat partial seizures in adults and children, and is also used off-label for bipolar disorder and neuropathic pain.
description: Oxcarbazepine is a dibenzazepine derivative structurally related to carbamazepine, but with a different metabolic profile that leads to fewer drug interactions and a lower risk of certain side effects. It blocks voltage-sensitive sodium channels, stabilizing hyperexcited neuronal membranes and inhibiting repetitive neuronal firing. It is metabolized to its active monohydroxy derivative (MHD) and is available in both immediate-release and extended-release forms.

items: Treatment of partial seizures in adults and children

sections.text: Oxcarbazepine inhibits voltage-gated sodium channels, stabilizing neuronal membranes and reducing synaptic transmission of excitatory signals. This results in a reduction of seizure activity.

adult.Partial Seizures (Monotherapy): Initial: 600 mg orally twice daily; titrate by 600 mg/day at weekly intervals as needed; usual maintenance: 1200-2400 mg/day divided twice daily
adult.Partial Seizures (Adjunctive): Initial: 300 mg orally twice daily; titrate as needed up to 1200-2400 mg/day

pediatric.Ages 4-16: Start at 8-10 mg/kg/day divided twice daily; increase weekly to a maximum of 46 mg/kg/day

sections.renal_impairment: Start at half the usual initial dose if CrCl < 30 mL/min; titrate slowly

sections.text: Onset within days to weeks for seizure control; steady state achieved in 2-3 days.

other: May cause clinically significant hyponatremia, especially within the first 3 months
Serious dermatologic reactions possible; screen for HLA-B*1502 in at-risk Asian populations
May cause suicidal thoughts or behavior

items.risk: May decrease levels due to induction

items: Serum sodium at baseline and periodically

sections.pregnancy: Category C: Use only if benefits outweigh potential risk
sections.lactation: Excreted in breast milk; use with caution
sections.pediatrics: Approved for use in children 2 years and older for adjunctive therapy

sections.text: Discontinue gradually over 2-6 weeks to minimize seizure risk.

items: Structurally related to carbamazepine but with improved side effect profile
Lower incidence of rash and hepatic enzyme induction compared to carbamazepine
Hyponatremia risk is higher than with carbamazepine; monitor closely
